newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel, Belarus start talks on trade accord.
newsitem.headline: Israel, Belarus start talks on trade accord.

text.p: Israel and Belarus started negotiations last week on a Most Favoured Nation (MFN) trade agreement, Israel's Ministry of Industry and Trade said on Monday.

The accord will abolish the need for import licences and will end all discrimination against bilateral imports compared with imports from other countries, said Gabriella Cohen, deputy director general of the foreign trade administration at the ministry.
The ministry said the agreement will be signed only after Belarus agrees not to discriminate against Israeli goods by subsidising local production.
Israel has signed similar agreements with three other countries of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) -- Russia, Ukraine and Moldova, Cohen said.
